clinical_study.brief_title: Epidemiology of Barrett's Esophagus: A Population Based Study
clinical_study.official_title: Epidemiology of Barrett's Esophagus: A Population Based Study

brief_summary.textblock:
To assess attitudes toward screening for esophageal adenocarcinoma (EAC) and Barrett's esophagus (BE) in the community.
To develop a population based clinical risk factor prediction model for the diagnosis of BE and identify novel risk factors for BE which would make population based screening more efficient. This will be an important first step in identifying the target population for BE screening, another crucial component of making screening feasible and efficient

primary_outcome.measure: The primary outcome from the survey will be the proportion of patients willing to undergo an esophageal capsule study compared to those willing to undergo an endoscopic procedure (Esophagogastroduodenoscopy or transnasal endoscopy)

secondary_outcome.measure: Study established (age, gender, ethnicity, reflux) and potential risk factors (sleep apnea, visceral adiposity, Helicobacter pylori infection, Metabolic Syndrome)to develop a clinical risk factor model for diagnosis of Barrett's esophagus(BE).

arm_group.description: Subjects with no history of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD)
Subjects with confirmed barrett's esophagus in Olmsted county
